dialog.text: "We've done the impossible, and that makes us mighty."

"Everything looks good from here... (beat...playing with plastic dinosaurs over his console) Yes. Yes, this is a fertile land, and we will thrive."  (as Stegosaurus) "We will rule over all this land, and we will call it... 'This Land'." (as T-Rex) "I think we should call it...your grave!"  (Stegosaurus) "Ah, curse your sudden but inevitable betrayal!" (T-Rex) "Ha ha HA! Mine is an evil laugh...now die!"

"I don't believe there's a power in the 'verse that can stop Kaylee from being cheerful." (he smiles at her, never stopping working) "Sometimes you just wanna duct tape her mouth and dump her in the hold for a month."
(kisses Mal) "I love my captain."
"Something ain't right."
"Sweetie, we're crooks.  If everything were right, we'd be in jail."
"Just a couple of days lying around.  You with the bathing,  me with the watching you bathe."
"I'd sure like to get a new compression coil."
"And I'd like to be the king of all Londinum and wear a shiny hat."
"Wheel always keeps on turning, Badger."
"That only matters to people on the rim."
"Crime and politics, little girl.  The situation is always... fluid."
"The only fluid I see here is the puddle of piss refusing to pay our wage."
"The destination's not important.  How you get there's the worthier part."
"Been out of the world for a spell.  Like to walk it a while."
"Ten percent of nuthin' is...let me do the math here...nuthin' into nuthin'...carry the nuthin'..."
"Jayne! Your mouth is talking, you'd might wanna look to that."
"Sir, we don't want to deal with Patience again."
"Why not?"
"She shot you."
"Well, yeah, she did a bit..."
"Ain't no way in the verse they could find that compartment, even if they were lookin' for it."
"Why not?"
"... cause?"
"Oh yeah, this is going to go great."
"If anyone gets nosy, just...you know... shoot 'em."
"Shoot 'em?"
"Politely."
"Send word to Patience?"
"Haven't heard back yet.  Didn't she shoot you one time?"
"Everyone's making a fuss."
(concerning Jayne) "What do you pay him for?"
"Public relations."
"Captain, do you mind if I say grace?"
"Only if you say it out loud."
"How's business?"
"None of yours."
"The important thing is the spices.  A man could live on enough  packaged food from here till judgment day as long as he has  enough rosemary."
"That's what governments are for, to get in a man's way."
(concerning Jayne) "What do you pay him for?"
"Public relations."
"So, would you like to lecture me on the wickedness of my ways?"
"I brought you some supper but if you'd prefer a lecture, I've a few very catchy ones prepped...sin and hellfire... one has lepers."
"Can we maybe vote on the whole murdering people issue?"
"Now, you only gotta scare him."
(beat) "Pain is scary."
"It's a girl. Cute too.  'Cept I don't think she's all there, you know? Course, not all of her has to be."
"I was gonna get me an ear."
"What will they do?"
"If they take the ship, they'll rape us to death, eat our flesh and sew our skins into their clothing and if we're very very lucky, they'll do it in that order."
"I have to say I didn't look to be hearing from you any time soon."
"Well, we may not have parted on the best of terms. I realize certain  words were exchanged, also, certain... bullets."
"I believe that woman's planning to shoot me again."
"Here's  a little concept I been workin' on. Why don't we shoot her first?"
"It is her turn."
"Testing, testing. Captain, can you hear me?"
"I'm standing right here."
"You're coming through good and loud."
"'Cause I'm standing right here."
"Don't think its a good spot sir, she still has the advantage over us."
"Everyone always does.  That's what makes us special."
"Well, you were right about this being a bad idea."
"Thanks for sayin', sir."
"Sir, I'd like you to take the helm pleases.  I need this man to tear all my clothes off."
"Work, work, work."
"Had a good day."
"You had the alliance on you, criminals and savages, half the people on this ship have been shot or wounded, including yourself, and you're harboring known fugitives."
"We're still flyin'."
"That's not much."
"It's enough."
(to Simon) "If I ever kill you, you'll be awake, you'll be facing me, and you'll be armed."
"That's a bold move."
"I live on the edge." (Zoe makes a devastating move)
"Nice work, dumbass."
"I've given some thought to moving off the edge. Not an ideal location. Maybe a place in the middle...."
"Hey, you gonna toast unification with me?  Six years today, the Alliance sent the Browncoats runnin', pissin' their pants... You know, your coat is kinda a brownish color."
"It was on sale."
"I'm thinking you're one of them Independents."
"And I'm thinking you weren't overburdened with schooling. So why don't we both ignore each other until we go away."
"Say that to my face."
"I said, you're a coward, and a pisspot.  Now what are you going to do  about it?"
"Nothing!  I just wanted you to face me so she could get behind you." (Zoe punches the thug out) "Drunks are so cute."
"Hey, I didn't fight in no war. Best of luck, though."
(into com) "Wash, we've got some local color happening. Your grand entrance would not go amiss right now."
"There's just an acre of you fellas, ain't there?" (to Zoe) "This is why we lost, you know. Superior numbers."
"Thanks for the re-enactment, sir."
"Every man there go back inside, or we will blow a new crater in this little moon."
"Damn yokels can't even tell a transport freighter ain't got no guns on it."
"So, what happened? Was there a terrible brawl?"
"Oddly enough, there was."
"Are you getting my wife into trouble?"
"What? I didn't start it! I just wanted a quiet drink."
"Funny, sir, how you always seem to find yourself in an Alliance-friendly bar come U-Day, looking for a quiet drink."
"See, this is another sign of your tragic space dementia, all paranoid and crotchety. It breaks the heart."
"Ladies and menfolk: We've got ourselves a job."
"Take us out of the world Wash, we've got us some crime to be done."
"Well they tell you: never hit a man with a closed fist. But it is, on occasion, hilarious."
"Mal. Bad. In the Latin."
"She's a little whimsical in the brainpan, seems calm enough though"
"That young man's very brave."
"Yeah.  He's my hero!"
"Well, what about you, Shepherd? How come you're flying about with us brigands? I mean, shouldn't you be off bringing religiosity to the Fuzzie-Wuzzies or some such?"
"Oh, I got heathens aplenty right here."
"If I'm your mission, Shepherd, best give it up. You're welcome on my boat. God ain't."
"You have such lovely hair. I'm sure the doctor would agree."
"Who, Simon? No, he's too... I'm just... Do you think it would look better up?"
"We could experiment. We might even get wild later and wash your face."
"There's an energy about a person that's difficult to hide. You try to feel that..."
"And then you try to feel the energy around their credit account. It has a sort of aura..."
(pissed) "What did I say to you about barging into my shuttle?"
"That it was manly and impulsive?"
"Yes, precisely. Only the exact phrase I used was 'don't'."
"And Kaylee, what the hell's goin' on in the engine room? Were there monkeys? Some terrifying space monkeys maybe got loose?"
"You're servicing crew now?"
"In your lonely and pathetic dreams."
"Mal! If you're being a gentleman, I may die of shock."
"You have seen Crow.  He loves to stand at the door to say 'Boo!'"
"Ooh!  You do not like I kill this man?"
"Oh, no. I'm sure he... was a very bad person."
"My wife's nephew.  At dinner I am getting earful.   There is no way out of that."
"He's a psycho, you know.  Niska."
"He's not the first psycho to hire us, or the last.  You think that's a commentary on us?"
"You could always pray they make it back safely."
"I don't think the captain would much like me praying for him."
"So don't tell him. I never do."
"Sir, I think you have a problem with your brain being missing."
"Hell, this job I would pull for free!"
"Then can I have your share?"
"No."
"If you die can I have your share?"
"So, what are we doing?"
"Oh, crime."
"Crime?  Good, OK... crime..."
"Time for some thrilling heroics."
"These are stone killers, little man. They ain't cuddly like me."
"They won't stop. They'll never stop. They'll just keep coming until they get back what you took. Two by two, hands of blue. Two by two, hands of blue..."
"How's about you shut that crazy mouth?  Is that a fun game?"
"Whatever happens, remember I love you."
"Sir?"
"Because you're my wife."
"Right, sir... honey."
"That sounds like the Alliance.  Unite all the planets under one rule so that everybody can be interfered with or ignored equally."
"You know what the chain of command is?  It's the chain I go get and beat you with until you understand who's in ruttin' command here."
"You can't change that... by gettin' all... bendy."
"All what?"
"You got the... the light... from the console... keep you... lift you up.  They shine like... (snatching at the air)... little angels..." (falls over, unconscious)
"Did he just go crazy and fall asleep?"
"Zoe. What would your husband say if he knew you were here?"
"I... I was weak."
"His story had kind of an odor to it."
"Yes. It's not the only thing about him that does."
"Nice shot."
"I was aiming for his head."

"You were truthful back in town -- these are tough times. A man can get a job, he might not look too close at what that job is. But a man learns all the details of a situation like ours.... well, then he has a choice. "
"I don't believe he does."
"Now, this is all the money Niska gave us in advance.  You bring it back to him, tell him the job didn't work out.   (Crow spits)

"We're not thieves. (beat)  Well, we are thieves.  Point is, we're not taking what's his.  Now, we'll stay out of his way the best we can from here on in.  You explain that that's best for everyone, okay?"
"Keep the money.  Use it to buy a funeral.  It doesn't matter where you go, or how far you fly.  I will hunt you down, and the last thing you see will be my blade."
"... Darn." (kicks Crow solidly, knocking him into one of Serenity's engines and killing him.  A second henchman is brought forward).  "Now, this is all the money Niska gave us in advance..."
(overeager) "Oh, I'm good!  Best thing for everyone!  I'm right
"Proximity alert. Must be coming up on something."
(alarmed) "Oh my god. What can it be? We're all doomed! Who's flying this thing!?" (deadpan) "Oh right, that would be me. Back to work."
"Tell you what I think -- I figure that fellow we ran into, did everyone on board. Then he decided to take a swim, see how fast his blood boiled out his ears."
"You're a very 'up' person."
"Should I remind you of the story of the Good Samaritan?"
"I'd rather if you didn't."

"It's impressive what 'nothing' can do to a man. Like that fellow we bumped into. He's likely stuck up under our belly about now. That's what space trash does, you know. Kind of latches onto the first big something stops long enough. Hey, now -- that'd be a bit like you and your sister, wouldn't it?"
"No one's gonna hurt you... any more than we already did."
"Ah, yes.  He's a real beast.  It's a wonder you're still alive."
"...Looked bigger when I couldn't see him."
"Reavers might take issue with that philosophy.  If they had a  philosophy.  If they weren't too busy gnawing at your insides."
"Looks like they've jury-rigged it with a pressure catch. It's the only thing that'd work with all these spare parts. We could probably bypass that easy, we get to the DC line."
"You tell me right now, little Kaylee, you really think you can do this?"
"Sure. Yeah. I think so. 'Sides, if I mess up, not like you'll be able to yell at me."
"Stack everything here, in plain sight.  Wouldn't want it to seem like we got anything to hide.  It might give them Alliance boys the wrong impression."
"Or the right one."
"That too."
"Looks to me like an illegal salvage operation."
"It does?  That's discouraging."
"You fought with Captain Reynolds in the war?"
"Fought with a lot of people in the war."
"And your husband?"
"Fight with him sometimes, too."
"Seems odd you'd name your ship after a battle you were on the wrong side of."
"May have been the losing side. Still not convinced it was the wrong one."
"Let's go again!"
"Later.  Maybe."
"You saved his gorram life, he still takes the cargo. Hwoon dahn." [jerk]
"He had to.... Couldn't let us profit. Wouldn't be civilized."
"I like watching the game. As with other situations, the key seems to be giving Jayne a heavy stick and standing back."
"'Course, they won't discover it 'til they order the next round of drinks."
"Way."
"Good drinker, that one."
"I thought you'd get land-crazy, that long in port."
"Probably, but I've been sane a while now and change is good."
"Sniff the air, we don't kiss the dirt"
"Wasn't planning on the dirt kissing, sir."
"I wouldn't stand for it anyway, captain, jealous man like me."
(Off an alarm sounding from the console) "Closing in."
"Planet's coming up a mite fast."
"That's just cause I'm going down too quick. Likely crash and kill us all."
"Well, that happens, let me know."
"Hmmm.  It sounds like one of the finest parties I could imagine  getting paid to go to."
"I don't suppose you'd find it up to standards of your outings.  More conversation and somewhat less petty theft and getting hit with pool cues."
"Look at the pretties!"
"What am I looking at, the girls or the clothes?"
(pointing to a pink frilly dress) "Say, look at the fluffy one!"
"Too much foofaraw. If I'm going to wear a dress, I'd want something with some slink."
"You want a slinky dress? I can buy you a slinky dress. Captain, can I have money for a slinky dress?"
"I'll chip in."
(to Jayne) "I can hurt you."
"I like the ruffles.  Inara gets to wear whatever she wants.
"What are you going to do in that rig?  Flounce around the engine room?  Be like a sheep walking on its hind legs" (Kaylee storms off)
(angry) "See ya on the ship, Captain."
"She mad or somethin?"
"Captain Reynolds, heard you was in town, though we might have a bit of a sit down."
"Prefer a bit of a piss off."
"I'm very sorry, did I give you the impression I was asking?"
"Seems to me the last time there was a chance for a little palaver, we were all manner of unwelcome."
(drinking) "This ain't bad."
"There's a trick to it: wood alcohol."
"Now we're favored guests, treated to the finest in beverages that make you blind."
"You backed out of a deal last time, left us hanging..."
"...hurt our feelings."
"You recall why that took place?"
"Had a problem with your attitude is why. Though you was... what's the word..."
"Pretentious?"
"Exactly!  You think you better than other people!"
"Just the ones I'm better than."
"Does, uh... does this seem kind of tight?"
"Shows off your backside. Did you see the chandelier? It's hovering."
""What's the point of that, I wonder.  I mean I see the how they did it,  I'm just not getting the why."
"These girls have the most beautiful dresses. And so do I-- how 'bout that!"
"Yeah, well, just be careful. We cheated Badger out of good money to buy that frippery, and you're supposed to make me look respectable."
"Yessir, Captain Tight Pants."
"Okay, help me find our man; he's supposed to be older. Kind of stocky, wears a red sash crossways."
"Why does he do that?"
"Maybe he won the Miss Persephone pageant. Just help me look."
"Is that him?"
"That's the buffet table."
"Well, how can we be sure, unless we question it?"
"I'm not saying the 80-04's hard to repair, it just ain't worth it."
"It's a fine machine, you just keep it tuned."
"Tsai boo shr." [That's not it.] "The extenders ain't braced."
"I've been telling him to buy the 80-10 for years."
"Those 'tenders snap off, don't matter how good the engine's cycling."
"Miss Kaylee, I wonder if I could request the honor of...."
(interrupting) "Wait a minute. Let her talk. She's talking. Dance later."
"By the way, the 80-10's the same machine, they just changed the plating and hope no one noticed."
(sighs) "I thought you wanted to spend more time off ship this visit."
"I don't know.  Out there it seems like all fancy parties. I like our  party better.  The dress codes easier and I know all the steps."
"Don't fall asleep now. Sleepiness is weakness of character. Ask anyone! You're acting captain. Know what happens you fall asleep now?"
"Jayne slits my throat and takes over."
"That's right."
"And we can't stop it."
"Well, I wash my hands of it. It's a hopeless case. I'll read a nice poem at the funeral. Something with imagery."
"You could lock the door and keep the power-hungry maniac at bay."
"Oh, no, I'm starting to like this poetry idea now. 'Here lies my beloved Zoe, my autumn flower, somewhat less attractive now she's all corpsified and gross'..."
"It's not as good as last year."
"Oh, really? What'd they have last year?"
"Standards."

"Why, Banning Miller! What a vision you are in your fine dress. It must have taken a dozen slaves a dozen days to get you into that getup.  Of course, your daddy tells me it takes the space of a schoolboy's wink to  get you out of it again."
"I know him. And I think he's a psychotic lowlife."
"And I think calling him that is an insult to the psychotic lowlife community."
"I see Kaylee's here."
"Cried Cinderella tears. You should have seen her when I told her she could have that layer cake she's wearing."
"I think she looks adorable."
"Yeah, but I never said it."
"Use of a swhat?"
Up until the punching, it was a real nice party.
"The captain's a good fighter, must know how to handle a sword."
"I think he knows which end to hold."
"Atherton's a heavy sleeper the night before a big day. You know, he's got the killing in the morning, then a haircut later."
"Such a comfort, having friends visit at a time like this."
"I actually thought I was defending your honor and I _never_ back down  from a fight!"
"Yes, you do. You do all the time."
"Well... yea... but I'm not backing down from this one."
"He's an expert swordsman, Mal -- you had trouble with the pillar. How will your death help my honor?"
"What we need's a diversion. I say Zoe gets naked."
"Nope."
"I could get naked."
"No!"
"Why ain't she talking? She's got a secret."

"Sure, I got a secret. More'n one. Don't seem likely I'd tell them to you now, do it?  Anyone off Dyton Colony knows better than to talk to strangers. You're talkin' loud enough for the both of us, though, ain't ya?  I've known a dozen like you. Skipped off home early.  Run graft jobs 'ere and there. Spent some time in the lockdown, but less than you claim.  Now you're what? Petty thief with illusions of standing.  Sad little king of a sad little hill."
"...Nice to see someone from the old homestead."
"Not really."  (to Simon)  "Call me if anyone interesting shows up."
"That there? Exactly the kind of diversion we could have used."
"Attack." (Mal lunges at her with sword; she sidesteps and swats him on the butt; he grunts in pain) "How did I avoid that?"
"By being fast like a freak?"
"You have a strange sense of nobility. You'll lay a man out for implying I'm a whore, but you keep calling me one to my face."
"You are always breaking the rules, no matter what society you're in!  You don't get along with ordinary criminals either, which is why you are constantly getting in trouble!"
"And you think following rules will buy you a nice life, even if the rules make you a slave."
"Don't take his offer."
"What?"
"Don't do it.  Because in the case that it happens, that means he's  the fellow that killed me. And I don't like fellows that killed me, not  in general."
"You have to finish it, lad. You have to finish it. For a man to lay beaten... and yet breathing? It makes him a coward."
"It's humiliation."

"Sure. It would be humiliating. Having to lie there while the better man refuses to spill your blood. Mercy is the mark of a great man. (lightly stabs Atherton with the sword) Guess I'm just a good one. (stabs him again) Well, I'm all right."
"You set this up, whore! After I bought and paid for you. I should have uglied you up so no one else would want you."
"See how I'm not punching him? I think I've grown."
"Well, get ready to starve! I'll see to it you never work again."
"Actually, that's not how it works. You see, you've earned yourself a black mark in the client registry. No Companion is going to contact with you ever again."
"You'll have to rely on your winning personality to get women. God help you."
"You didn't have to wound the man."
"Yeah, I know, it was just funny."
"We was just about to spring into action, Captain. Complicated escape-and-rescue operation."
"I was going to watch. It was very exciting."
"Thank you for the wine. It's very... fresh."
"To Kaylee, and her inter-engine fermentation system."
"Are you in pain?"
"Absolutely. I got stabbed, you know. Right here."
"I saw."
"Don't care much for fancy parties. Too rough."
"It wasn't entirely a disaster."
"I got stabbed! Right here!"
"You also lined up exciting new crime."
"It's good to have cargo.  Makes us a target for every other scavenger  out there of course, but, sometimes that's fun too."
"I am grateful, you know. For the ill-conceived and high-handed attempt to defend my honor although I didn't want you to."
"Gracious as that is, as I look back, probably should have stayed out of  your world."
"We got outflanked by an Independent squad, and we're never gonna make it back to our platoon. We need to resort to cannibalism."
"That was fast. Don't we have rations or anything?"
"They got lost. We're going to have to eat the men."
"I will not have it in my house. But since your mother's already ordered one, I guess I might as well give up the fantasy that this is my house."
"So, she's added cussing and hurling about of things to her repertoire. She really is a prodigy."
"It's just a bad day."

"No, a bad day is when someone's yellin' spooks the cattle. Understand? You ever see cattle stampede when they got no place to run? It's kind of like a...a meat grinder. And it'll lose us half the herd."
"She hasn't gone anywhere near the cattle."

"No, but in case you hadn't noticed, her voice kinda carries. We're two miles above ground and they can probably hear her down there. Soon as we unload, she can holler until our ears bleed." (to River) "Although I would take it as a kindness if she didn't."
"The human body can be drained of blood in 8.6 seconds given adequate vacuuming systems."
(to Simon) "See, morbid and creepifying, I got no problem with, long as she does it quiet-like."
"You know, they walk just as easy if you lead them."
"I like smackin' them."
"Next time we smuggle stock, let's make it something smaller."
"Yeah, we should start dealing in those black-market beagles..."
"Little soul big world.  Eat and sleep and eat...  Many souls.  Very straight, very simple"
"Cattle on the ship three weeks, she don't go near 'em.  Suddenly, we're on Jiangyin and she's got a driving need to commune with the beasts?"
"They weren't cows inside.  They were waiting to be, but they forgot.  Now they see sky and they remember what they are."
"Is it bad that what she just said makes perfect sense to me?"
"When a man engages in clandestine dealings, he has this preference for things going smoothly. She makes things not be smooth."
"Right. I'm very sorry she tipped off anyone about your cunningly concealed herd of cows."
"Does it seem every supply store on every border planet has the same five rag dolls and the same wood carvings of... What is this?  A duck?"
"That's a swan.  And I like it"
"You do?"
"It looks like it was made with, you know... longing.  Made by a person who really longed to see a swan."
"Perhaps because they'd only heard of them by rough description."
"This is the last time.  The last time with cows.  I hear there is  an idea involving beagles, they have smallish droppings?"
"I believe so sir."
"Scrawny."
"Milk and hay, three times a day, fed to them by beautiful women."
"It was something to see."
"They's branded."
"Now you boys are hitting all the selling points.  A fresh  brand is a dead give-away. Claim them as your own."
"We can go to 25."
"Well... we'll be taking a loss. But you seem like clean and virtuous boys. Done."
"It never goes smooth.  How come it never goes smooth?"
"That's... that's quite a lot of blood, isn't it?"
"Just means you ain't dead."
" 'fraid I might be needin' a preacher."
"That's good.  You just lie there and be ironical." (to Jayne) "Stretcher!"
"Some of these words -- they're misspelled. She started correcting my spelling when she was three."
"That bad?"
"Battle wounds are nothing new to me, preacher. I've seen men live with a dozen holes in 'em this size."
"That right?"
"Surely is. Knew a man once who had a hole clean through his whole shoulder. Used to keep a spare hankie in there."
(mock reading Simon's journal) "Dear Diary...today I was pompous and my sister was crazy." (flips page) "Today, we were kidnapped by hill folk never to be seen again. It was the best day ever."
"Well, we're headed for help... right?"
"Captain will come up with a plan."
"That's good. Right?"
"Possibly you're not recalling some of his previous plans."
"You sanguine about the kind of reception we're apt to receive on an Alliance ship, Cap'n?"
"Absolutely." (beat) "What's 'sanguine' mean?"
" 'Sanguine'. Hopeful. Plus -- point of interest -- it also means 'bloody'."
"Well, that pretty much covers all the options, don't it?"
"Place like this might be good for your sister. Quiet,  safe, place where folks take care of each other."
"Yes, seems like a lovely little community of kidnappers."
"I took you away from there."
"No."
"I know I did. You don't think I do, but... I get confused. I remember everything. I remember too much and.... Some of it's made up and... some of it can't be quantified and there's secrets..."
"It's okay."
"But I understand. You gave up everything to find me, and you found me broken. It's hard for you. You gave up everything you had."
"Mei mei, everything I have is right here."
"These are better than the Camberson's berries."
"They are. Except they're poison."
"It's been a big day, what with the abduction and all."
"I'm sorry, Dad. You know I would never have tried to save River's life if I'd known there was a dinner party at risk."
"Are you trying to destroy this family?"
"I didn't realize it would be so easy."
"What kind of ident card gets us that kind of reception and send off?"
"I am a Shepherd. Folks like a man of God."
"No, they don't. Men of God make everyone feel guilty and judged."
"Well, look at this! Appears we got here just in the nick of time. Whaddya suppose that makes us?"
"Big damn heroes, sir."
"Ain't we just!"
"Sorry to interrupt, folks.  Y'all got something that belongs to us  and we'd like it back."
"This is a holy cleansing, you cannot think to thwart God's will."

"Y'all see the man hanging out of the spaceship with the really big gun? Now I'm not saying you weren't easy to find but it was kinda out of our way, and he didn't want to come in the first place. Man's lookin' to kill some folk. So really, it's his will y'all should worry about thwarting."
(to Simon) "Gotta say, doctor, your talent for alienatin' folk is near miraculous."
"Yes, I'm very proud."
"Cut her down."
"That girl is a witch!"
"Yeah, but she's our witch.  So cut her the hell down!"
"So finally...a decent wound on this ship, and I miss out. I'm sorry."
"Well, you were busy trying to get yourself lit on fire. It happens."
"So Shepard says to a Companion, "Well, a good goat will do that." "
"And I think maybe you're gonna give me a little one-on-one time with the missus."
"Oh, I think you might wanna reconsider that last part. See, I married me a powerful ugly creature."
"How can you say that? How can you shame me in front of new people?"
"If I could make you purtier, I would."
"You are not the man I met a year ago."

"Now think real hard. You been bird-dogging this township a while now. They wouldn't mind a corpse of you. Now you can luxuriate in a nice jail cell, but if your hand touches metal, I swear by my pretty floral bonnet, I will end you."
"So, explain to me again why Zoe wasn't in the dress?"
"Tactics, woman! Needed her in the back. 'Sides, them soft cotton dresses feel kind of nice. There's a whole airflow."
"And you would know that because...?"
"You can't open the book of my life and jump in the middle. Like woman, I'm a mystery."
"Best keep it that way. I withdraw the question."
"I'm sorry.  Go back to the part where you're my wife."
(downcast) "I don't please you."
"You can't please me.  You've never met me." (Zoe and Jayne enter) "Zoe, why do I have a wife?"
"You got a wife?"
"What's she doing here?"
"All I got was that dumb-ass stick that sounds like it's raining.  How come you got a wife?"
"I didn't." (to Saffron) "We're not married."
"I'm sorry if I shame you..."
"You don't shame me.  Zoe, get Wash down here."
(hits comm) "This is Zoe.  We need all personnel in the cargo bay."
"All?  I said Wash!"
"Captain, everyone should have a chance to congratulate you on your day of bliss."
"There's no bliss!  I don't even know this girl."
"Then can I know her?"
"Jayne!  Don't sully this."
"Zoe, you are going to be cleaning out the latrine with your face, you don't cut that out."
"Who's the new recruit?"
"Everybody, I want you to meet Mrs. Reynolds."
(excited) "You got married?!"
"Well, that's... congratulations."
"We always hoped you two kids would get together.  Who is she?"
"She's no one!" (Saffron starts to cry)
"Captain!"
(at a loss) "Stop that."
"I'm... sorry..."
"You brute."
(to Saffron) "Oh, sweetie, don't feel bad.  He makes everybody cry.  He's like a monster."
"I'm not a monster.  Wash, turn the ship around."
"This isn't happening." (to Saffron) "Will you stop crying?"
"Oh, for God's sake, Mal, can you be a human being for thirty seconds?"
"Speaking as one married man to another..."
"I am not married!" (to Saffron) "I'm sorry.  You don't shame me, you have very nice qualities but I didn't ever marry you."
(holding encyclopedia) "I believe you did.  Last night." (Mal hesitates, as does everyone)
(to Jayne, quiet) "How drunk was I last night?"
"If you take sexual advantage of her, you're going to burn in a very special level of hell. A level they reserve for child molesters and people who talk at the theater."
"What -- I am not... preacher, you've got a smutty mind!"
"Perhaps I spoke out of turn."
"You may perhaps I'm thinking!"
"I apologize.  I'll make her up a room in the passenger dorm."
"Good" (Book walks away and around the corner.  A beat later, he pokes his head back around to speak)
"The *special* hell."
"Are you gonna kill me?"
"What?  What kind of crappy planet is that?  Kill you?"
"In the maiden's home, I heard talk of men who weren't pleased with their brides, who..."

"Well I ain't them. And don't you ever stand for that sort of thing. Someone tries to kill you, you try to kill 'em right back. Wife or no, you're no one's property to be tossed aside. You got the right same as anyone to live and to try to kill people. I mean, you know. People that are... That's a dumb planet."
"I'd be a good wife."
"Yeah, well, I'd be a terrible husband.  You got five whole days to figure that out."

"I didn't think to make enough for your friends." (to Zoe) "But I've everything laid out if you'd like to cook for your husband..." (Wash looks at Zoe for a microsecond of hope, before laughing overcompensationally)
"Ta ha ha... Isn't she quaint?  I'm just not hungry..."
(to Mal) "So, are you enjoying your own nubile little slave girl?"
(mouth full) "I'm not... (chewing) nubile ... (swallows) Look, she wanted to make me dinner.  At least she's not crying..."
"I might.  Did she really make fresh bao?" (notices Zoe's glare) "Quaint!"
"Remember that sex we were planning to have ever again?"
"I would appreciate it if one person on this boat did not assume I was an evil, lecherous hump."
"Nobody's saying that, sir."
"Yeah, we're mostly just giving each other significant glances and laughing incessantly.  Is that cider?"
"Can I come in?"
"No."
"See, that's why I usually don't ask."
"Are you offering me a trade?"
"A trade!? Hell, it's theft. This is the best damn gun made by man. It has extreme sentimental value. It's miles more worthy than what you got."
"What I got? She has a name."
"So does this!" (caresses the gun lovingly) "I call it Vera."
"Well, my days of not taking you seriously are certainly coming to a middle."
"Jayne: Go play with your night-stick."
"You're a good man."
"You clearly haven't been talking to anyone else on this boat..."

"Every planet has its own weird customs.  About a year before we met, I spent six weeks on a moon where the principal form of recreation was juggling geese.  My hand to God.  Baby geese.  Goslings.  They were juggled"
"Of course the man rushes in to defend her..."
"(Huh?) I'm talking about geese."
(looking at Saffron, shocked) "Whoa, hey... flesh..."

"On the night of their betrothal, the wife shall open to the man as the furrow to the plow. He shall work in her again and again, 'til she bring him to his full. And rest him then upon the sweat of her breast."
"Whoa - good bible..."
"Oh, I'm gonna go to the special hell..."

"Wuh duh ma huh ta duh fung-kwong duh wai-shung doh (Holy mother  of God and all her wacky nephews), do I wish I was somebody else right now.   Somebody not married, not madly in love with a beautiful woman who can  kill me with her pinky."
"I've been too forward."
"No.  Well, yes.  But I actually like that in a woman.  That's part of why Zoe and I are, as previously mentioned, married."
"I thought... she didn't seem to respect you."
"Not everybody gets me and Zoe at first glance.  Did it get very hot in here?  I need airflow."
"Come into my shuttle."
"You would lie with me?" (alarms sound)
"I guess we've lied enough."
(to Mal) "You were drugged."
"That's why I never kiss 'em on the mouth" (Everyone falls deathly silent)
"So you two were kissing?"
"Well, isn't that... special?"
"You woulda kissed her too!"
"Wash didn't."
"But she was naked!  And... articulate!"
"Okay.  Everyone NOT talking about their sex lives, in here.  Everyone else, elsewhere."
"You were victimized, Wash was assaulted, and then Inara found you here."
"And then I fell and hit my head.  Like Wash."
"So why the big act?  What was she after?"
"Besides molesting innocent captains?"
"You want to stow it, preacher?  We're in some peril here."
"If she can fly this thing, why'd she take the shuttle?"
"Maybe she likes shuttles.  Some people juggle geese!"
"See, Vera? Dress yourself up you get taken out somewhere fun."
"You gonna kill me?"
"Can you conjure up a terribly compelling reason for me not to?"
"I didn't kill you."
"You handed me and my crew over to those that would kill us. That buys you nothing."
(smiles) "I made you dinner."

"You got all kinds of learning, and you make me look a fool without even trying, and yet here I am with a gun to your head. That's cause I got people with me, people who trust each other, and do for each other, and ain't always looking for an advantage."
"Promise me you're going to kill me soon."
"I swear - when it's appropriate."
"Simon, the whole point of swearing is that it ain't appropriate."
(seeing Inara off) "Goodbye, now.  Have good sex!"
"My God - you're like a trained ape.  Without the training."
(to Jayne) "Enemies?  You?  No, how can it be?"
"All right, fine, I'll go... Just, stop describing me."
"Yes, I... I've heard good things about the mud.  Lots of people talking about the mud..."
(to Kaylee) "What happened to Simon?  Who is this diabolical master of disguise?"
"You wanna tell me how come there's a statue of you here, looking at me like I owe him something?"
"Wishin' I could, Captain."
"No, seriously, Jayne, you want to tell me--?"

"Look, Mal, I got no ruttin' idea. I was here a few years back, like I said. Pulled a second-story, stole a lot of scratch from the magistrate up on the hill. But things went way south. I had to hightail it. They don't...put you on a pedestal in town square for that."
"Yeah, 'cept I'm looking at some fair compelling evidence says they do."
(staring at the statue) "This must be what going mad feels like."
(looking at Jayne's statue) "I think they captured him, though.  You know, captured his essence."
"Looks sorta angry, don't he?"
"That's kinda what I meant."

"Uh, hey, I got a idea. Instead of us hanging around playing art critic 'til I get pinched by the man, how's about we move away from this eerie-ass piece of work, and get on with our increasingly eerie-ass day. How's that?"
"I don't know.  This here's a spectacle might warrant a moment's consideration."
"What are we up to, sweetheart?"
"Fixing your Bible."
"I, um...(alarmed)...what?"
"Bible's broken. Contradictions, false logistics - doesn't make sense." (she's marked up the bible, crossed out passages)
"No, no. You - you can't... "

"So we'll integrate non-progressional evolution theory with God's creation of Eden. Eleven inherent metaphoric parallels already there. Eleven. Important number. Prime number. One goes into the house of eleven eleven times, but always comes out one. Noah's ark is a problem."
"Really?"
"We'll have to call it early quantum state phenomenon. Only way to fit 5000 species of mammal on the same boat." (rips out page)
"River, you don't... fix the Bible."
"It's broken.  It doesn't make sense."
"You don't fix faith, River.  It fixes you."
"Can't be a statue of me.  No reason for it.  Flies in the  face of every kind of sense."
"Won't argue with that."
(spits out his first taste of his drink) swears in Chinese
"Mmm. They call it 'mudder's milk."
(gags)
"All the protein, vitamins and carbs of you grandma's best  turkey dinner... plus 15 percent alcohol.
"Last week, the factory foreman and his prod crew heard he was moving contraband through town.  Gave him a peck of trouble for it."
"What kind of peck was that?"
"The kind where they hacked off his hands and feet with a machete, rolled him into the bog."
"They peck pretty hard around here."
"Uh, Jayne?"
"Yeah, Mal?"
"You got any light you'd like to shed on this development?"
"No, Mal."
"No... *This* must be what going mad feels like..."
"We gotta go to a crappy town where I'm a hero!"
"You know... I've saved lives. Dozens. Maybe hundreds. I reattached a girl's leg - her whole leg. She named her hamster after me. I got a hamster. He drops a box money, he gets a town."
"Hamsters is nice."
"To Jayne! The box-dropping, man-ape-gone-wrong... thing."
"I tore these out of your symbol, and they turned into paper."
"They say the snow on the roof was too heavy. The ceiling will cave in, his brains are in terrible danger!"
"River? Please. Why don't you come out?"
"No! Can't! Too much hair!"
"River, honey, he's putting the hair away now."
"Doesn't matter.  It'll still be there... waiting."
"You guys had a riot?  On account of me?  My very own riot?"
"I can't believe you're back."
(all emotional) "How could I stay away?!!"
"You think we should be using my fame to hoodwink folks?"
"You better laugh when you say that."
"Is that Jayne? Is that really him? Wash, pinch me, I must be dreaming!"

"I.. I know this man. He's... he just has this idiotic sense of nobility, you know?  He can never just let things go. He thinks he's this hard-hearted criminal and he can be unrelenting, but... there's a side to him that's just so...."
"You mean you actually know Jayne?"
"Jayne? Jayne Cobb?"
"Just keep walking, preacher-man."
"So, when we made love last night..."
"When we what???"
"You really are such an easy mark!"
"It's my estimation that... every man ever got a statue made of him was one kind of sumbitch or another. It ain't about you, Jayne. It's about what they need."
"You paid money for this, sir? On purpose?"
"What? Come on, seriously, Zoe. Whaddya think?"
"Honestly, sir? I think you got robbed."
"Robbed? What? No. What do you mean?"
"It's a piece of fei-oo." [fei-oo. = junk]
"Fei-oo? Okay, she won't be winning any beauty contests anytime soon. But she's solid. Ship like this, be with ya 'til the day you die."
"Cause it's a deathtrap."
"You are very much lacking in imagination."
"I imagine that's so, sir."
"Try and see past what she is, to what she can be."
"What's that, sir?"
"Freedom, that's what."
(pointing) "I meant, what's that?"
"Oh. Yeah, just step around that. I think something must have been living in here."
"Get her running again?"
"Yeah.
"So, not running now?"
"Not so much."
"Now, Inara, she's gotta have some real funny whorin stories, I wager."
"Oh, do I ever!  Funny and sexy!  You have no idea.  And you never will."
"How did you know?  River, did you...?"
"Day is a vestigial mode of time measurement based on solar cycles.  It's not applicable."  (beat)  "I didn't get you anything."
"Catalyzer on the port compression coil blew.  That's where the trouble started."
"I need that in Captain Dummy talk, Kaylee."
"I love this ship.  I have from the first moment I saw it."
"I just don't want to die on it."
"I don't want to die at all."
"Don't be afraid.  That's what it says, don't be afraid."
"Yes."
"You're afraid we're going to run out of air.  That we'll die gasping.  But we won't.  That's not going to happen.  We'll freeze to death first."
"Wave your arms around, jump up and down, divert the navsats to the transmitter, whatever."
"Divert the navsats to-- Right! Because teenage pranks are fun when you're about to die!"
"Even if some passerby did happen to receive it, all it would do is muck up their navigation."
"Could be that's true."
"Damn right it's true! They'd be forced to stop and dig out our signal before they could even go anyplace." (Mal stares)
"Well, maybe I should do that, then!"
"Maybe you should!"
"Okay!"
"Good!"
"Fine!"
"What do you two think you're doing?  Fightin' at a time like this."   (beat) "You'll use up all the air."
"Ain't nothin wrong with your grav boot.  Grav boot's just fine.  Hello!"
"She doesn't... that's not what... no it ain't!"
"Sure it is.  Grav boot ain't your trouble.  I seen the trouble plain as day when I was down there on my back before..."
"Jayne'll be worth something if you run into trouble, but don't trust him, and don't let him take over. You're paid up through the end of the month, this is still your ship."
"As far as your security deposit goes, that I might have to owe you. "
"If it's Alliance trouble you got, you might want to consider another ship. Some onboard here fought for the Independents."
"The Alliance has no quarrel with me. I supported Unification."
Did ya?  Well, I don't suppose you're the only whore that did."
"Oh, one further addendum -- that's the last time you get to call me "whore"."
"Absolutely. Never again."
"And try not to talk. Talking uses up air.  Ain't no need for it."
"Mal, you don't have to die alone."
"Everybody dies alone."
"Which one do you figured tracked us?"
"The ugly one, sir."
(beat) "Could you be more specific?"
"Well, looks can be deceiving."
"Not as deceiving as a lowdown, dirty... deceiver."
"Well said. Wasn't that well said, Zoe?"
"Had a kind of poetry to it, sir."
"You want I should shoot 'em now, Marco?"
"Wait till they tell us where they put the stuff."
"That's a good idea.  Good idea. Tell us where the  stuff's at, so I can shoot ya."
(raises hand) "Point of interest. Offering to shoot us  might not work so well as an incentive as you might imagine."
"I mean, let's say you did kill us... or didn't. There could be torture - whatever - but somehow, you found the goods. What would your cut be?"
"Seven percent, straight off the top."
"Seven? Oh."
"What?"
"Hmm? Nothing. Not a thing. No, I just... (to Zoe) does that seem low to you?"
"It does, sir."
"That ain't low."
"Stop it!"
"Seven percent, standard."
(laughs) "Okay. Zoe, I'm paying you too much."
"Catalyzer's a nothing part, captain."
"It's nothing until you don't got one. Then it appears to be everything."
"You would have done the same."
"You can already see I haven't.  Now get the hell off my ship."
"Could you please tell my wife the fun she's missing out on?"
"Ariel's quite nice place, actually.  There are some lovely museums, not to mention some of the finest restaurants in the quadrant."
"But not boring like she made it sound."
"You could have got off with Shepard Book at Bathgate Abbey.  You could have been meditating on the wonders of your rock garden by now."
"Well, it beats just sitting."
"It IS just sitting."
"Could you not do that while we're... ever?"
"Two days in a hospital?  Don't you just hate doctors?"
"Hey!"
"Present company excluded."
"Let's not be excluding people.  That'd be rude."
"You know, it's all very sweet, stealing from the rich, selling to the poor..."
"Figures.  First time on the Core and what do I get to do? Dig through trash.  Why couldn't he send me shopping at the triplex, or...  Oooh, synchronizers!"
"Patients were cynical and not responding and we couldn't bring 'em back-"
"They were cyanotic and not responsive."
(to Jayne) "What about cortical electrodes?"
"Oh..." (obviously doesn't know the answer) "We forgot 'em."
"Pupils were fixed and dilapidated-"
"Dilated-"
"Dilated! Dilated! Ching-wao tsao duh liou mahng!" [Frog-humping sonofabitch]
"Hell, I don't know.  If I'd wanted schooling, I'd have gone to school."
"Now all we need is a coupla patients."
"Corpses, actually. For this plan to work, River and I will have to be dead."
(smiling) "I'm starting to like this plan."
"Look, you got a little stabbed the other day.  It's bound to make anyone a mite ornery."
"Nothing buys bygones quicker than cash."

dialog.person: River (startling Jayne, jumping up from unconsciousness)
dialog.text: "Copper for a kiss?"
"Two lefts, two rights, and we're there. You see anyone, smile."
"I don't think anyone smiles in hospitals."
"Course they do, it's the Core. Everyone's rich and happy here, why wouldn't they smile?"
"Walk with me a minute."
"Where're we going?" (Zoe sneaks away, around and behind the doctor)  Pompous Doctor:"You see this badge? It says 'doctor'. I say walk, you walk."
"Yeah but, where're we going?"

"You must be new." (Zoe walks up behind him) "Don't get comfortable, your type never lasts long around here. When your supervisor hears about the rude and disrespect--ARGH!!!" (falls to the ground, unconscious, revealing Zoe standing behind him with defib paddles)
(shrugs) "Clear."
(cryptically to Jayne) "They took Christmas away."
(confused) "What the hell now?"
"Came downstairs for the shiny presents...they took the tree, and the stockings...nothing left but coal."
(to Simon) "Would you shut her up?"
(to Jayne) "Don't look in the closet, either -- it's greedy." (smiles) "It's not in the spirit of the holiday."
"You shut the hell up right now or so help me, I'll shut you up."
"Can we find someplace with a beach?"
(grinning and skipping to her) "Maybe a naked beach?" (they kiss)
"Cut it out. Job's not done 'til we're back on Serenity."
"Sorry, sir, didn't mean to enjoy the moment."

"Agent McGinnis, I'm certain you're working under a superior keeping close tabs on this case. I'm certain of that because important people don't do fieldwork. I'm also certain your superior wants me and my sister alive. Now, I'm not going to move from this start until one of two things happens: you answer my very simple question, or you shoot me."
"We're transferring you to a holding center, until you can be retrieved."
"Retrieved? By who?"
"People who want you alive.  People, not me."
Shee-nio high tech Alliance crap!"
"Hey there, Inara! How was your checkup?"
"Same as last year. What's going on?"
(cheerfully) "Oh well let's see...we killed Simon and River, stole a bunch of medicine, and now the Captain and Zoe are off springing the others  that got snatched by the feds."
"Hey! How was your thing?"
"As advertised -- lots of needles and cold exam tables. I heard you had some excitement."
"Oh, nothin' much -- lotsa runnin' round, little gunplay...couple needles."
"He was amazing! (to Jayne) "We wouldn't be standing here if it weren't for you."
"Well, uh...you're part of my crew."
(sarcastic) "I think I might cry."
"You called the Feds."
"What?  I got pinched!"
"Which is what happens when you call the Feds."
"You know, I hear tell they used to keelhaul traitors back in the day.  I don't have a keel to haul you on, so..."
"What are you taking this so personal for? It ain't like I ratted you out to the Feds."
"But you did. You turn on any of my crew, you turn on me! If that's a concept that you can't seem to wrap your head around, then you got no place here. You did it to me, Jayne, and that's a fact."
"Next time you decide to stab me in the back, have the guts to do it to my face."
"Is it time to go to sleep again?"
"No, mei mei.  It's time to wake up."
"He said, 'Live with a man forty years, share his house, his meals, speak on every subject... then tie him up and hold him over the volcano's edge. And on that day, you will finally meet the man.' "
"What if you don't live near a volcano?"
"I expect he was being poetical."
"Sadistic crap legitimized by florid prose. Tell me you're not a fan."
"I'm just wondering if they were. The people who did this to your sister."
"A government is a body of people -- usually notably ungoverned.
"Now you're quoting the captain."
"Yes, I'd forgotten you're moonlighting as a criminal mastermind now. Got your next heist planned?"
"No. But I'm thinking about growing a big black mustache. I'm a traditionalist."
"Don't worry, I'm not gonna start any sword fights -- I'm over that phase."
"One of you is going to fall and kill yourself, and I'm not cleaning it up!"
"It's Jayne being so generous with his cut that confuses and frightens me."
"It does kind of freeze the blood."
"We mentioned that we were out of rations, and ten minutes later, a bunch of apples rained into the trench."
"And they grew into a big tree, and they all climbed up the tree into a magical land with unicorns and a harp."
"And then came the lying to me about it, which for me is sort of the highlight of this little adventure."
"Is there any way I'm gonna get out of this with honor and dignity?"
"You're pretty much down to ritual suicide, lamby-toes."
"I love that you two are old Army buddies, you have wacky stories with rib cages in them, but could you have an opinion of your own, please?"
"You're losing the high ground here, sweetcakes."
"I am a large, semi-muscular man. I can take it. Don't hide behind Mal because you know he'll shoot it down!"
"Right. Because what this marriage needs is one more shouting match."
"No, what this marriage needs is one less husband. Right now it's kind of crowded."
"Going back. Like apple bits, coming back up."
"But you felt okay this morning?"

"Played with Kaylee. The sun came out and I walked on my feet and heard with my ears. I ate the bits.. the bits that stay down and I work, I function like I'm a girl. I hate it because I know it'll go away. The sun grows dark and chaos has come again.  Its fluids.... What am I?"
"You are my beautiful sister."
"I threw up on your bed."
"Yup. Definitely my sister."
"Didn't want you taking off without me. In fact, didn't want you taking off at all. Thought I might take this run instead. Me and the Captain."
"The Captain who's standing right here telling you that's not gonna happen?"

"Well, it's a dangerous mission, sir. I can't stand the thought of something happening that might cause you two to come back with another thrilling tale of bonding and adventure. I just can't take that right now."
"Okay, um, I'm lost. Uh, I'm angry, and I'm armed, so if you two have something that you need to work out --"
(to a departing Zoe) "Bye, hon! We promise not to stop for beers with the fellas!" (sits down, starts the engines, then to Mal) "So, are we gonna sing army songs or something?"
"Hey, I've been in a firefight before! Well, I was in a fire." (beat) "Actually, I was fired from a fry-cook opportunity."
"I'll be in my bunk."
"This is precision work; sharpshooters. From the look of these wounds, I'd say a 54-R sniper rifle. Laser sights."
"Do a lot of shooting at the abbey there, Shepard?"
"Rabbits."

"I don't want you to spare me, Mal. If you think you know what's happening, then you tell me. You wouldn't spare Zoe if she were in this situation with you, would you? You would be planning, and plotting and possibly scheming. So whatever Zoe would do in this instance is what I wanna do. Do you know why? No matter how ugly it gets, you two always come back with the stories. So... I'm Zoe. Now, what do I do?"
"Probably not talk quite so much."
"Right. Less talking. She's terse. I can be terse. Once in flight school, I was laconic."
"I mean, I'm the one that she swore to love, honor and obey."
"Listen, if..." (beat) "She swore to obey?"
"Well, no, not... But that's just my point! You she obeys! She obeys you! There's obeying going on right under my nose!"
(to Mal) "Screw you!"
"Get in line!"
"This is not enough.  Not enough for two.  But sufficient  perhaps for one.  Ah, now you have to..."
"Him. I'm sorry, you were going to ask me to choose, right?  Do you want to finish?"
"Well, it's a clean cut.  With the right equipment, I should be able to reattach it.  That's assuming there's a head..."
"Do you know the writings of Shan Yu?"
"You starting a book club."
"We're getting him back!"
"What are we going to do, clone him?"
"This is not a time for extraordinary men. Business is not war, heroics are unseemly. They complicate."
"Grenades?"
"Oh, yes. Thank you, dear."
"We're going to get the captain."
"Oh... Good.... Can they do that?"
"No."
"Preacher, don't the Bible have some pretty specific things to say about killing?
"Quite specific. It is, however, somewhat fuzzier on the subject of kneecaps."
"It's like throwing a dart, Jayne, and hitting a bullseye 6,000 miles away. That's my man."
"Okay, people -- if it moves, shoot it."
"Unless it's the captain!"
"Unless it's the captain."
"Listen, if you got guests, I can come back later."
"No power in the 'verse can stop me."
"This is something the Captain needs to do himself." (Jayne lowers his gun)
(Calling back to them) "No, it's not --"
"Oh."  (All aim and fire in unison)
"I just wish you'd killed that old bastard."
"I got regrets on that score my own self."
"I never shot anyone before."
"I was there, son. I'm fair sure you haven't shot anyone yet."
(unenthusiastically) "I know it's a difficult mission, but you and I... have to get it on."
(unenthusiastically) "I understand.  We have no choice. Take me, sir.  Take me hard."
"Now something about that is downright unsettling..."
"Yep... that went well."
"Damn you, Bridget! Damn you ta Hades! You broke my heart in a million pieces! You made me love you, and then y-- I SHAVED MY BEARD FOR YOU, DEVIL WOMAN!"
"Whoa there, Cap'n...tell me you didn't get into a fight with Monty."
"Really? But I thought we loved Monty!" (to Zoe, uncertain) "Don't we love Monty?"
"Sweetie, if he had a tussle with that Sasquatch, we'd be in the dirt right about now, scoopin' up the Captain's teeth."
"I'm not sleeping with you, Mal."
"Uh, no, I think I would have noticed. I think my keenly  trained senses would..."
"This is one of the crazier things I've heard today and when I tell you about the rest of my day, you'll appreciate..."
"Hey, no, we'll just set course for Planet of the Lonely, Rich, and Appropriately Hygienic Man. I'll just tell Wash, we can park there for a month."
"Right. You're a criminal mastermind. What was the last cargo we snuck past the Alliance to transport?"
"That was--"
"What was the cargo?"
"They were dolls."
"They were little geisha dolls with big heads that wobbled!"
"Hey, people love those!"
"Petty?"
"I didn't mean petty."
"What did you mean?"
"Suo-shee?"
"That's Chinese for petty."
"I'm confused--"
"You're asking yourself: if I've got the security  codes, why don't I grab it for myself?"
"No, actually, I was wondering...  What's she doing on  this ship?  Didn't she try to kill us?"
"Please. Nobody died last time."
"We're in space.  How'd she get here?"
"She hitched."
"I don't recall pulling over."
"Captain says you're to stay put. Doesn't want you runnin' afoul of his blushin' psychotic bride. She figures out who you are, she'll turn you in 'fore you can say... 'don't turn me in, lady'."
(looking at Jayne) "She's a liar."
"That don't exactly set her apart from the rest of us. And the plunder sounds fun enough."
"She's a liar and no good will come of her."
"Well, I say as a rule that girlfolk ain't to be trusted."
"Jayne is a girl's name."
"Well, Jayne ain't a girl!  If she starts in on that 'girl's name'  thing,  I'll show her good an' all I got man parts."
"I'm trying to think of a way for you to be cruder. It's just not coming."
(to Durran) "They set on me at Parth, these awful men..."
"That wasn't me, though.  I don't know those men..."
"They said they wanted ransom, but they... they sold me to slavers..."
"Also unknown to me."
"We gotta move fast."
"Yeah, he might come back and hug us in the act."
"He's my husband."
"Well who in the damn galaxy isn't?"
"I hate to bring up our imminent arrest during your crazy time, but we gotta move."
"I should've killed Durran."
"Right. The one guy that don't have it coming. The man who knows you and still loves you, treachery and all. Can't have him walking about."
"I've seen you without your clothes on before.  Never thought I'd see you naked."
"You won't tell anyone about me breaking down?
"I won't."
"Then I won't tell anyone how easily I got your gun out of your holster."
"I'd take that as a kindness."
"Also, I can kill you with my brain."
"You call this going well?"
"We got the loot, didn't we?"
"Yes, but--"
"Then I call it a win.  What's the problem?"
"Should I start with the part where you're stranded in the  middle of nowhere... or the part where you have no clothes?"
"Oh my god, it's grotesque! Oh, and there's something in a jar."
"Scared her away again, did you?"
"This may come as a shock, but I'm actually not very good at talking to girls."
"Why, is there someone you are good at talking to?"
(to a jar with a cow fetus, mock-serious) "Do not fear me. Ours is a peaceful race, and we must live in harmony..."
(trying to eat an 'ice-planet') "My food is troublesome."
"I got post?"
"Might we all want to step back a few paces before he opens that?"
"Ha ha. It's from my mother."
(wearing ugly homemade hat) "How's it sit? Pretty cunning,  don'tchya think?"
"I think it's the sweetest hat ever."
"Makes a statement."
"Yeah, yeah!"
"A man walks down the street in that hat, people know he's not afraid of anything."
"Damn straight."
"Thanks. Didn't know you were there."
"That's sort of the point. Stealth, you may have heard of it."
"I don't think they covered that in basic."
"Well, at least they covered 'Dropping your weapon so you can eat beans and get yourself shot'."
"Yeah, I got a badge in that."
"Vitelli's out of it. That bumblebee laid down arms at the first sign of inevitable crushing defeat, can you imagine such a cowardly creature?"
"Everybody dies, Tracey.  Someone's carrying a bullet for you right now, doesn't even know it.  The trick is to die of old age before it finds you."
"We're taking him on board?"
"We are."
"Don't figure the percentage in that."
"Don't strain your brain trying, then. Might break something."
"I don't get this.  They're after Tracey?"
"Or there's something else in that box." (later)
"Anything?"
"Not unless this crate's made of magical wish-granting planks."
"Using corpses for smuggling is a time-honored repulsive custom."
"Maybe it's gold!"
"And maybe this was a friend of ours, and you wanna show a little respect."
"I got respect.  But I'm just saying... gold!"
"When you can't run anymore, you crawl, and when you can't do that, you find someone to carry you."
"That call means you just murdered me!"
"You murdered yourself, son.  I just carried the bullet for a while."
"Hi."
(terribly startled while working on his guns) "BWAAA!"
"Sorry, I didn't mean to startle."

"You didn't." (repeating, as if he meant to) "BWAAA!  That's kind of a warrior... It's a... strikes fear into..." (nothing) "Bwaa?" (gives up) "You know, it ain't altogether wise, sneaking up on a man when he's handling a weapon."
"You know, not altogether wise, sneaking up on a man when he's handling his weapon."
"I'm sure I've heard that said. But perhaps the dining area isn't the place for this sort of thing?"
"What do you mean? Only place with a table big enough."
"Of course. In that case..." (rearranges guns) "Every well-bred petty crook knows -- the small concealable weapons always go to the far left of the place setting."
"This distress call wouldn't be taking place in someone's pants, would it?"
"It sounds like the sort of thing this crew can handle. I can't guarantee they'll handle it particularly well, but-"
"If they got guns, and brains at all..."
"They have guns."
"No one's gonna force you to go, Jayne. As has been stated -- this job's strictly speculative."
"Good. 'Cause I don't know these folks, don't much care to."
"They're whores."
"I'm in."
"Any friend of Inara's is a strictly business-like relationship of mine."
"I'll introduce you to the rest of the crew later.  They're good folk."
(calls out from across the room) "Can I start gettin' sexed already?"
"Well, that's one kind of horrific."
"My John Thomas is about to pop off and fly about the room, there's so much tasty in here."
"Would be you'd get you most poetical about your pecker."
"Everybody's got somebody..." (wistfully) "Wash, tell me I'm pretty..."
"Were I unwed, I would take you in a manly fashion."
"'Cause I'm pretty?"
"'Cause you're pretty."
"Thank you.  That was very restorative."
"Inara, think you could stoop to being on my arm?"
"Will you wash it first?"
"Well, lady I must say..." (admiring smile) "...you're my kinda stupid."
"I ain't so afraid of losing something that I ain't gonna try to have it."
(near a woman in labor) "Who do you think is in there?"
"Miss Nandi, I have a confession to make."
"Maybe I should get the Shepherd."
"Well, I ain't sinned yet, and I'd feel more than a little awkward having him here when I do."
"Captain seem a little funny to you at breakfast this morning?"
"Come on, Kaylee. We all know I'm the funny one."
"This is just a moment in time.  Step aside and let it happen."
"Jonah, say hello to your daddy." (aims gun).  "Say goodbye to your daddy, Jonah." (fires)
"I wish I was lying!  I just... you know, we'd all made surgeon.  That was it.  We were the elite.  The world was ours, you know."
"So you had to be naked?"
"Naked, yes.  And on top of the statue of Hippocrates.  Can't you just picture me?"
"What, naked?  Oh well, hmm... let's see.  I'm gonna have to conjure up... Yeah, that's gonna be difficult... so, did the Feds come?"
"This is not funny.  This is a morality tale about the evils of sake."
"It was either that or the National Anthem.  Reports vary."
"Saint Jayne, it's got a ring to it!"
"I'm just trying to remember how many miracles you've performed."
"I once hit a guy in the neck from 500 yards with a bent scope.  Does that count upstairs?"
"Oh, it will be taken into consideration."
"You made that sound kind of ominous."
"It's just an object.  Doesn't mean what you think."
"Fully loaded, safety off.  This here's a recipe for unpleasantness.  Does she understand that?"
"She understands.  She doesn't comprehend.
"Well, I'm glad we've made that distinction."
"When I want a lot of medical jargon, I'll talk to a doctor.
"You are talking to a doctor."
"We're in deep space, corner of no and where."
"Little River just gets more colorful by the moment. What'll she do next?"
"Either blow us all up or rub soup in our hair. It's a toss-up."
"I hope she does the soup thing. It's always a hoot, and we don't all die from it."
"Let's move this conversation in a not-Jayne's-fault direction."
"Anyone remember her coming at me with a butcher knife?"
"Wacky fun..."
"You want to go, little man?"
"Only if it's someplace with candlelight."
"I don't think she'd harm anyone."
"Butcher knife!"
"Anyone we can't spare."
"Didn't make much account of myself, I'm afraid."
"I got no problem with the notion of you not killing no one, Kaylee."
"She just did the math."
"This is not a joking matter!  This is about our lives!  And River's."
"She's just a kid.  She just... wants to be a kid."
"But she does have an oddness to her. And I ain't just talking about her proficiency with firearms. Girl knows things. Things she shouldn't. Things she couldn't."
"Wha-...are you-are you sayin' she's a witch?"
(sarcastically) "Yes, Jayne. She's a witch. She has had congress with the beast."
"She's in Congress?"
(amazed) "How did your brain even learn human speech? I'm just so curious."
"Psychic, though? That sounds like something out of science fiction."
"We live in a space ship, dear."
"... and if wishes were horses we'd all be eating steak!"
"Don't let the space bugs bite!  (embarrassed, to herself) "Space bugs?"
"Strains the mind a bit.  You think you're all alone... Maybe I come down the chimney, Kaylee.  Bring presents to all the good girls and boys.  Maybe not, though.  Maybe I've always been here."
"And which part of your plan dictated the necessity of beating up a shepard?"
"That ain't a shepard."
"Is it still her room when it's empty?  Does the room, the thing, have purpose?  Or do we... What's the word?"
"I really can't help you."
"So you're a bounty hunter."
"That ain't it at all."
"Then what are you?"
"I'm a bounty hunter."
"They make psychiatrists get psychoanalyzed before they can get certified, but they don't make surgeons get cut on.  That seem right to you?"
"You ever been shot?"
"No."
"You out to be shot.  Or stabbed.  Lose a leg.  To be a surgeon, you know.  Know what kind of pain you're dealing with."
"Come on out, River.  The nice man wants to kidnap you."
"This is pointless, you know."
"200,000 seems fairly pointed to me."
"Serenity is a smuggling ship.  I've been here a year, I couldn't name all the places she might hide."
"I don't have a year." (beat) " Your sister is being a real annoyance."
"I feel for you."
"Man is stronger by far than woman, but only woman can create a child.  Does that seem right to you?"
"You know, with the exception of one deadly and unpredictable midget, this girl is the smallest cargo I've ever had to transport. Yet by far the most troublesome. Does that seem right to you?"
"What'd he do?"
"Who?"
"The midget."
"Arson. Little man loved fire."
"You're wrong about River.  River's not on the ship.  They didn't want her here, but she couldn't make herself leave.  So she melted... Melted away.  They didn't know she could do that, but she did."
"I'm not sure I take your meaning there."
"I'm not on the ship.  I'm in the ship." (beat) "I am the ship."
"River..."
"River's gone."
"Then who exactly are we talking to?"
"You're talking to Serenity.  And, Early... Serenity is very unhappy."
"I only hurt people because they keep getting in the way of me
"Tell her."
"What am I?  Your advocate?"
(aiming his gun) "You are now."
"He's really very... gentle... and fuzzy.  We're becoming fast friends."
"You folks are all insane."
"Well, my sister's a ship.  We had a complicated childhood."
Doesn't anybody care that I have a finely crafted gun pointed at this boy's head?"
"Where'd she go?"
"I can't keep track of her when she's not incorporeally possessing a spaceship.  Don't look at me."
"There's a guy.. he's very blurry.  You gotta be careful." (beat) "Oh... how come there's a guy on board?  How come you're all of a sudden the ship?"
"I know you have questions."
"That would be why I just asked them."
"Am I dreaming?"
"We all are." (beat) "Don't make faces."
"How about his face?  Is his face wearing armor?"
"No touching guns!"
"I'll be a son of a whore!  You're not in my gorram mind!  You're in my gorram ship!"
"You're not right, Early.  You're not righteous.  You got issues.
"No.  Well, yes.  I could have that."

"Don't belong.  Dangerous, like you.  Can't be controlled.  Can't be trusted.  Everyone can just go on without me and not have to worry.  People could be what they wanted to be.  Could be with the people they wanted.  Live simple.  No secrets..."
"I'll be fine.  I'll be your bounty, Jubal Early.  And I'll just fade away."
"Permission to come aboard?"
"You know, you ain't quite right."
"It's the popular theory."
"Go on.  Get in there. Give your brother a thrashing for messing up your plan."
"He takes so much looking after."
"This is really not my area of expertise, doctor.  I tend to be putting these into people more than the other thing."
"Can I mop your brow?  I am at the ready with the fearsome brow mopper."
"You got the bullet.  Okay, I'm going to pass out now, but you're doing great."
"All them years of priest training, taken out by one bounty hunter."
"Don't get me wrong, I gave him a hell of a fight."
"Epic, I'm guessing."
"There'll be poems and songs, just you wait."
"At least you got some play.  I missed every damn thing."
"Well... here I am..."
"Nineteen.  Twenty."
"And done." (The cashier hands Mal a wad of bills; Mal starts to count it.)
"Not that I don't trust you... but I don't trust you."
"Let's go get us some of those curly carrots.  Love 'em deep fried." (Wash starts to move Zoe off; she stops him and turns to Mal)
"Capt'n?"
(drops arm) "Yeah, dad.  Can we go?  Promise to be home before midnight."
"Go.  Wouldn't want to be responsible for cold curly carrots."
"Guess I'm not giving you money."
"No."
(smilin') "Well, unless there'd be some kind of benefit for the exchange of said money..."
"Definitely, no."
"Then I suppose the least I can do is escort you to the fair."
"How adolescent... and charming of you."
"River has never been to a fair and she hasn't had a chance to do much that is fun in awhile..."
"Alliance jail could be fun."
"You shouldn't feel bad you didn't guess the fat lady's weight. I actually thought it was quite sweet to drop fifty pounds."
"Seemed a wise choice."
"Now you can't tell me that an attractive lady like yourself has never been escorted to a fair?"
(laughing) "They weren't quite the thing where I was raised." (Mal stops, not loving that comment, then tosses another ring. Makes it again.)
"Poor little Inara, not allowed to get her hands dirty with us common folk."
(taken aback) "That's not what I --"  (Mal throws another) "I guess not everyone's lucky enough to fulfill their lifelong dream of becoming an expert ring tosser."
"Thanks to the good Alliance people of Verbena, our gear shift factory is opening ten days ahead of schedule." (The crowd around the stage cheers. Mal claps, hollers.)
"Oh, yeah. Let's all hear it for the good Alliance."
"Jayne."
"<Bastards> singed my turtle." (Everyone stares at Jayne)
"Let me find a medic."
"Thanks."
"Yeah?"
"Purple elephants are flying."
"Good.  Thanks for the update."
"What should I do?"
(hands her bandages): "Tie it off."
"Simon, I'm good with anatomy, but not like this..."
"Zoe?"
"Yeah."
"What if this guy, you know, did it?"
"Trust me, darling, this guy couldn't even tie his shoelaces if it wasn't described to him using step by step graphics."
"Come out, come out, wherever you are.  We won't hurt you... much."
"Hey!"
"Sorry."
"Got any thread?" (Holds up stuffed turtle; its neck is almost gone) "His floppy neck's makin' me sad."
(sweet voice) "And the beautiful princess every night prayed for her handsome prince... "
(continuing) "... to fight through the terrible ivy of thorns and climb up to her room and slay all the wicked, evil demons... "

(much later, sweetly sing-songy) "And then the beautiful princess got tired of waiting for her handsome prince and tried to escape, but they found her and to punish her they locked her in a smelly, white, cold room where the evil blue demons strapped electrodes to her face and started to shock her. Zap, zap, zap, until she couldn't stop screaming. Only no one could hear." (River remains smiling; the kids not so much.  In fact, they're just a little bit freaked out by the story and by the freaky lady telling it)
"The Central Planets formed the Alliance, so everyone can enjoy the comfort and enlightenment of true civilization."
"Do you know what your sin is?"
"The minds behind every diplomatic, military, and covert  operation in the galaxy, and you put them in a room with a psychic."
"In certain older civilized cultures, when men failed as  completely as you have, they would throw themselves on their swords."
"Well, unfortunately, I forgot to bring a sword..." (Schhhhing -- the Operative pulls one out)
"I believe in something that is greater than myself.  A  better world.  A world without sin."
"So me and mine got to lie down and die so you can live in your  better world?"
"I'm not going to live there.  There's no place for me there."
"Every minute you keep River Tam from me, more people will die."
"You think I care?"
"Of course you do.  You're not a reaver, Mal."
"I don't murder children."
"I do.  If I have to."
"This is a good death.  There is no shame in this."
"This landing is gonna get pretty interesting."
"Define 'interesting'".
"Oh God, oh God, we're all gonna die?"
"We may experience some slight turbulence and then... explode."
"Explode?  I don't wanna explode!"
"You told me the entry couplings would hold for another week!"
"That was six months ago, cap'n."
"Fear is nothing to be ashamed of, Doc."
"This isn't fear.  This is anger."
"Well, it's hard to tell the one from t'other, face like yours."
"I imagine if it were fear, my eyes would be wider."
"I'll look for that next time."
"I am taking your sister under my protection here.  That means that if anything happens to her, I swear to you I will get very choked up.  Honestly.   There could be tears."
"It's okay to leave them to die."
"Are those grenades?"
"Cap'n doesn't want 'em."
"We're robbing the place.  We're not occupying it."
"Shiny.  Lets be bad guys."
"We mean to be thieving here, but what we are after is not yours.  So let's have no undue fuss."
"I see a head start to rise, violence is gonna ensue."
"You know what the definition of a hero is?  It's someone who gets other  people killed.  You can look it up later."

dialog.person: Zoe (after breaking into a nearly empty bank safe)
dialog.text: "At last, we can retire and give up this life of crime."
"You have to give me your authorization password." (Jayne fires down into the vault... there is a delay)
"Okay!"
"Leg's good.  It'll bleed plenty and we avoid any necessary organs."
"I was thinking, more of a graze..."
"Well, you don't want it to look like you just gave up."
"Come a day there won't be room for naughty men like us to slip about at all."
"Mal!  MAL!"
"Every heist, he's gotta start yelling my name."
"Faster.  Faster.  Faster would be  better!!!"
"Boy, sure would be nice to have some GRENADES, don'tcha think?"
"I won't get eaten!  You shoot me if they take me!" (Mal aims toward Jayne in an attempt to free him)
"Well don't shoot me FIRST!"
"He didn't lie down.  They never lie down."
"Are you okay?"
"Is HE okay?"

dialog.person: Simon (rushing to River, who is seemingly unfazed)
dialog.text: "River?"
"I swallowed a bug."
"I'll kill a man in a fair fight... or if I think he's going to start a fair fight... or if he bothers me, or if there's a woman.. or I'm gettin' paid. Mostly if I'm gettin' paid."
"Don't ride in anything with a Capissen 38  engine, they fall right out of the sky!"
"It's not safe..."
"Yes.  Yes, I fear it's not safe anymore."
"...for them."
"In the time of war, we woulda never left a man stranded."
"Maybe that's why we lost."
"Mingo.  Fanty."
"He's Mingo."
"He's Fanty.  You're Mingo."
"Ghahh!  How is it you always know?"
"Fanty's prettier."
"Goin' on a year now I ain't had nothin' twixt my nethers weren't run on batteries."
"Oh God!  I can't know that!"
"I could stand to hear a little more..."
"You know that girl?"
"I really don't..."
"Can we start with the part where Jayne gets knocked out by a ninety pound girl?  'Cause I don't think that's ever getting old."

dialog.person: Jayne (interrupting the "safe words" that make River fall asleep)
dialog.text: "Well don't say it!!!"
"It only works on her, Jayne."
"Oh.  Well, now I know that."
"Didn't we have a intricate plan how they was gonna be not here anymore?"
"We couldn't leave them now...!"
"No, now that she's a... killer woman, we oughta be bringing her tea and dumplings."
"You guys always bring me the very best violence."
"Put a bullet to me.  Bullet in the brainpan, squish."
"It isn't mine.  The memory.  I didn't bring it and I shouldn't have to  carry it, it isn't mine."
"Am I talking to Miranda now?"  (River makes a face)  "No.  Right."
"You got a plan?"
"Hiding ain't a plan?"
"When I talk about belief, why do you always assume I'm talking about God?"
"Kaylee's been missing you something fierce."
"So.. Trap?"
"Trap."
"We goin' in?"
"Ain't nothin' but a few hours out."
"But, remember the part where it's a trap?"
"How can you be sure Inara just don't wanna see you?  Sometimes people have feelings - I'm referring here to people..."
"Y'all were watching, I take it?" (guilty glances)
"Did you see us fight?"
"No."
"Trap."
"Zoe, ship is yours.  ...you don't hear from me within the hour, you  take this ship and you come and rescue me!"
"What?  And risk my ship?"
"Dear Buddha: please send me a pony, and a plastic rocket, and..."
"Mal, what are you doing here?"
"You invited me."
"Yes, but I never thought for a second you'd be stupid enough to come!"
"Well that makes you kind of a tease, doesn't it?"
"I'm impressed that you would come for her yourself.  And that  you would make it this far in that outfit."
"It's worse than you know."
"It usually is."
"That girl will rain destruction down on you and your ship.  She's  an albatross, Captain."
"Way I remember it, albatross was a ship's good luck... till some idiot  killed it." (to Inara) "Yes, I've read a poem.  Try not to faint."
"If the alliance wanted to show me reason, they shouldn't have sent an  assassin."
"You can not make me angry."
"Please - spend an hour with him!"
"I want to resolve this like civilized men.  I'm not threatening you.  I'm unarmed."
"Good." (draws and fires; operative falls to the ground, but comes back up fighting)
"I am of course wearing full body armor.  I am not a moron."
"Nothing here is what it seems.  He's not the plucky hero.  The  Alliance isn't some evil empire.  This isn't the grand arena."
"And that's not incense." (explosion ensues)
"Have you found the nav sat?"
"Sir?  We found seven."
"Define 'disappeared'."
"Do you really think any of us are gonna get through this?"
"... I might..."
"It's not your way."
"I have a way?  Is that better than a plan?"
"I'm a monster.  What I do is evil, I've no illusions about that.   But it must be done."
"They'll come at you sideways.  It's how they think: sideways.   Sidle up and smile, hit you where you're weak."
"No offense, Doc, I think it's noble as a grape the way you  look after River, but she ain't my sister, and she ain't your crew."
"You all got on this boat for different reasons, but you all come to the same place.  So now I'm asking more of you than I have before.  Maybe all.

dialog.person: 'Cause as sure as I know anything, I know this
dialog.text: they will try again.   ...they'll swing back to the belief that they can make people... better.   And I do not hold to that.  So no more running.  I aim to misbehave."
"Are you anything but a weapon?  I've staked my crew's life on the theory  that you're a person, actual and whole, and if I'm wrong, you'd better shoot me  now..." (River cocks gun)
"... or, we could talk more."
"I had to show them.  I didn't know if you were going to make me sleep."
"You could have asked."
"Do you want to run this ship?"
"Yes."
(beat) "Well... you can't!"
"I just want to know who I'm dealing with.  I've seen too many versions  of you to be sure."
"I start fighting a war I guarantee you'll see something new."
".... I wish like hell you was elsewhere."
"I was."
